content: As someone paying off student loans, with complete payoff on the horizon, I am conflicted on this issue.The job-market has been hard on a lot of people, especially recent graduates--it's a lot more complicated that the straw-man argument some people like to use about "useless degrees"--and am not unsympathetic to this reality. At  the same time I did my homework and kept my debt level below a a realistic starting salary and have made sacrifices to stay current on my loans. Giving people what is essentially "a get out of jail free-card" on student loans, as some have proposed doing, is not fair to people like me who have been responsible in borrowing and repaying their student loans.
